data.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Admits 'I Don't Have Warm Shells To Plug Into' — While OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Warns Cheap Energy Could Upend AI
data.description: Artificial intelligence may have hit an unexpected snag — there aren't enough powered data centers to keep up with the machines driving it. And now, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) has AI chips sitting idle because there's nowhere to plug them in. On the "BG2Pod," a technology and investing podcast hosted by Brad Gerstner and Bill Gurley and featuring OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said the shortage of power has become the industry's biggest constraint. data.keywords: Sam Altman, Microsoft, data centers, Microsoft, Bill Gurley, OpenAI, Brad Gerstner, Artificial intelligence
